     125             : /* This defines the name of the Python entry function that is expected
     126             :  * to exist when importing this module from Python. Use a different
     127             :  * function name for Python 2 versus 3 so that trying to import the
     128             :  * wrong version will give a reasonably-meaningful dynamic-link error
     129             :  * rather than randomly crashing.
     130             :  *
     131             :  * MUST MATCH SAME NAME IN "pyhooks/*.c"
     132             :  */
     133             : #define FFPY_PYTHON_ENTRY_FUNCTION PY3OR2(fontforge_python3_init, fontforge_python2_init)
     134             : PyMODINIT_FUNC FFPY_PYTHON_ENTRY_FUNCTION(const char* modulename);
     135             : 
     136             : 
     137             : /* ========== MODULE DEFINITIONS ========== */
     138             : /* The following types are used to define Python Modules.  For every
     139             :  * module, you must create a 'module_definition' structure describing
     140             :  * it.  Then toward the bottom of this file in the "MODULE REGISTRY"
     141             :  * section, make sure you add the module to the list of all modules.
     142             :  */
     143             : 
     144             : typedef int (*type_initializer)(PyTypeObject *);
     145             : 
     146             : /* Typedef 'python_type_info' -- Create an array of these, one for

     148             :  * array with a sentinel using the TYPEINFO_EMPTY macro
     149             :  */
     150             : typedef struct {

     269             : static void PyFF_PickleTypesInit(void);
     270             : 
     271             : /* A contour is a list of points, some on curve, some off. */
     272             : /* A closed contour is a circularly linked list */
     273             : /* A contour may be either quadratic or cubic */
     274             : /* cubic contours have two off-curve points between on-curve points -- or none for lines */
     275             : /* quadratic contours have one off-curve points between on-curve -- or none for lines */
     276             : /*  quadratic contours may also have two adjacent off-curve points, in which case an on-curve point is interpolated between (as in truetype) */
     277             : /* A layer is a set of contours all to be drawn together */
     278             : 
     279             : 
     280             :

     379             :                 result = (cmp <= 0) ? Py_True : Py_False;
     380             :                 break;

     382             :                 result = (cmp == 0) ? Py_True : Py_False;
     383             :                 break;

     386             :                 break;

     388             :                 result = (cmp > 0) ? Py_True : Py_False;
     389             :                 break;

     391             :                 result = (cmp >= 0) ? Py_True : Py_False;
     392             :                 break;

     394             :                 result = Py_NotImplemented;
     395             :         }

     415             : /* FlagsFromTuple() - Converts a python sequence of strings into a flags integer.

     417             :  * If flagkind is not NULL, then it is used in any error message to identify
     418             :  * the kind of flags being parsed.

    1718           0 : static int PyFFPoint_compare(PyFF_Point *self,PyObject *other) {
    1719             :     double x, y;
    1720             : 
    1721             :     /* I'd like to accept general sequences but there is no PyArg_ParseSequence*/
    1722           0 :     if ( PyTuple_Check(other) && PyTuple_Size(other)==2 ) {
    1723           0 :         if ( !PyArg_ParseTuple(other,"dd", &x, &y ))
    1724           0 : return( -1 );
    1725           0 :     } else if ( PyType_IsSubtype(&PyFF_PointType, Py_TYPE(other)) ) {
    1726           0 :         x = ((PyFF_Point *) other)->x;
    1727           0 :         y = ((PyFF_Point *) other)->y;
    1728             :     } else {
    1729           0 :         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError, "Unexpected type");
    1730           0 : return( -1 );
    1731             :     }
    1732           0 :     if ( RealNear(self->x,x) ) {
    1733           0 :         if ( RealNear(self->y,y))
    1734           0 : return( 0 );
    1735           0 :         else if ( (double)self->y>y )
    1736           0 : return( 1 );
    1737           0 :     } else if ( (double)self->x>x )
    1738           0 : return( 1 );
    1739             : 
    1740           0 : return( -1 );

    2440           0 : static PyObject *PyFFContour_Slice( PyObject *self, Py_ssize_t start, Py_ssize_t end ) {

    2442             :     PyFF_Contour *ret;
    2443             :     int len, i;
    2444             : 
    2445             :     /* When passed in, start,end >= -cont->pt_cnt */
    2446             :     /* However, start,end can be arbitrarily large, particularly when the notation c[i:]
    2447             :         is used, in which case end is a very large value (max size of uint). */

    2449           0 :         start += cont->pt_cnt;

    2451           0 :         start = cont->pt_cnt;

    3227           0 : static PyObject *PyFFContour_draw(PyFF_Contour *self, PyObject *args) {
    3228             :     PyObject *pen, *tuple;
    3229             :     PyFF_Point **points;
    3230             :     int i, start, off, last, j;
    3231             : 
    3232           0 :     if ( !PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"O", &pen ) )
    3233           0 : return( NULL );
    3234           0 :     if ( self->pt_cnt<2 )
    3235           0 : Py_RETURN( self );
    3236             : 
    3237           0 :     points = self->points;
    3238             :     /* The pen protocol demands that we start with an on-curve point */
    3239             :     /* this means we may need to rotate our point list. */
    3240             :     /* The pen protocol allows a contour of entirely off curve quadratic points */
    3241             :     /*  so make a special check for that (can't occur in cubics) */
    3242           0 :     for ( start=0; start<self->pt_cnt; ++start )
    3243           0 :         if ( points[start]->on_curve )
    3244           0 :     break;
    3245           0 :     if ( start==self->pt_cnt ) {
    3246           0 :         if ( self->is_quadratic ) {
    3247           0 :             tuple = PyTuple_New(self->pt_cnt+1);
    3248           0 :             for ( i=0; i<self->pt_cnt; ++i ) {
    3249           0 :                 PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,i,PointTuple(points[i]));
    3250             :             }
    3251           0 :             PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,i,Py_None); Py_INCREF(Py_None);
    3252           0 :             do_pycall(pen,"qCurveTo",tuple);
    3253             :         } else {
    3254           0 :             PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError, "A cubic contour must have at least one oncurve point to be drawn" );
    3255           0 : return( NULL );
    3256             :         }
    3257             :     } else {
    3258           0 :         if ( start!=0 ) {
    3259           0 :             points = malloc(self->pt_cnt*sizeof(struct PyFF_Point *));
    3260           0 :             for ( i=start; i<self->pt_cnt; ++i )
    3261           0 :                 points[i-start] = self->points[i];
    3262           0 :             off = self->pt_cnt - start;
    3263           0 :             for ( i=0; i<start; ++i )
    3264           0 :                 points[i+off] = self->points[i];
    3265             :         }
    3266             : 
    3267           0 :         tuple = PyTuple_New(1);
    3268           0 :         PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,0,PointTuple(points[0]));
    3269           0 :         do_pycall(pen,"moveTo",tuple);
    3270           0 :         if ( PyErr_Occurred()) {
    3271           0 :             free(points);
    3272           0 : return( NULL );
    3273             :         }
    3274           0 :         last = 0;
    3275           0 :         for ( i=1; i<self->pt_cnt; ++i ) {
    3276           0 :             if ( !points[i]->on_curve )
    3277           0 :         continue;
    3278           0 :             if ( i-last==1 ) {
    3279           0 :                 tuple = PyTuple_New(1);
    3280           0 :                 PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,0,PointTuple(points[i]));
    3281           0 :                 do_pycall(pen,"lineTo",tuple);
    3282           0 :             } else if ( i-last==3 && !self->is_quadratic ) {
    3283           0 :                 tuple = PyTuple_New(3);
    3284           0 :                 PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,0,PointTuple(points[i-2]));
    3285           0 :                 PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,1,PointTuple(points[i-1]));
    3286           0 :                 PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,2,PointTuple(points[i]));
    3287           0 :                 do_pycall(pen,"curveTo",tuple);
    3288           0 :             } else if ( self->is_quadratic ) {
    3289           0 :                 tuple = PyTuple_New(i-last);
    3290           0 :                 for ( j=last+1; j<=i; ++j )
    3291           0 :                     PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,j-(last+1),PointTuple(points[j]));
    3292           0 :                 do_pycall(pen,"qCurveTo",tuple);
    3293             :             } else {
    3294           0 :                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError, "Wrong number of off-curve points on a cubic contour");
    3295           0 : return( NULL );
    3296             :             }
    3297           0 :             if ( PyErr_Occurred())
    3298           0 : return( NULL );
    3299           0 :             last = i;
    3300             :         }

    3305           0 :             PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,2,PointTuple(points[0]));
    3306           0 :             do_pycall(pen,"curveTo",tuple);

    3308           0 :             tuple = PyTuple_New(i-last);
    3309           0 :             for ( j=last+1; j<i; ++j )
    3310           0 :                 PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,j-(last+1),PointTuple(points[j]));
    3311           0 :             PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,j-(last+1),PointTuple(points[0]));
    3312           0 :             do_pycall(pen,"qCurveTo",tuple);

    3314             :     }
    3315             : 
    3316           0 :     if ( PyErr_Occurred())
    3317           0 : return( NULL );
    3318             :

    3623           0 : static int PyFFLayer_compare(PyFF_Layer *self,PyObject *other) {
    3624           0 :     const double pt_err = .5, spline_err = 1;
    3625             :     int i,j,ret;
    3626             : 
    3627           0 :     ret = PyFFLayer_docompare(self,other,pt_err,spline_err);
    3628           0 :     if ( !(ret&SS_NoMatch) )
    3629           0 : return( 0 );
    3630             : 
    3631             :     /* There's no real ordering on these guys. Make up something that is */
    3632             :     /*  at least consistent */
    3633           0 :     if ( PyType_IsSubtype(&PyFF_ContourType, Py_TYPE(other)) )
    3634           0 : return( -1 );
    3635             : 
    3636             :     /* Ok, both are layers */
    3637           0 :     if ( self->cntr_cnt < ((PyFF_Layer *) other)->cntr_cnt )
    3638           0 : return( -1 );
    3639           0 :     else if ( self->cntr_cnt > ((PyFF_Layer *) other)->cntr_cnt )
    3640           0 : return( 1 );
    3641             :     /* If there's a difference, then there must be at least one point to be */
    3642             :     /*  different. And we only get here if there were a difference */
    3643           0 :     for ( j=0; j<self->cntr_cnt; ++j ) {
    3644           0 :         PyFF_Contour *scon = self->contours[j], *ocon = ((PyFF_Layer *) other)->contours[j];
    3645           0 :         if ( scon->pt_cnt<ocon->pt_cnt )
    3646           0 : return( -1 );
    3647           0 :         else if ( scon->pt_cnt>ocon->pt_cnt )
    3648           0 : return( 1 );
    3649           0 :         for ( i=0; i<scon->pt_cnt; ++i ) {
    3650           0 :             ret = PyFFPoint_compare(scon->points[i],(PyObject *) ocon->points[i]);
    3651           0 :             if ( ret!=0 )
    3652           0 : return( ret );
    3653             :         }
    3654             :     }
    3655             : 
    3656           0 : return( -1 );           /* Arbitrary... but we can't get here=>all points same */
    3657             : }
    3658             : 
    3659             : #if PY_MAJOR_VERSION >= 3
    3660             : static PyObject *PyFFLayer_richcompare(PyObject *a, PyObject *b, int op) {

    4035           3 : static int PolyCheck(SplineSet *poly) {
    4036             :     SplineSet *ss;
    4037             :     SplinePoint *sp;
    4038             :     BasePoint pts[256];
    4039             :     int cnt;
    4040             : 
    4041          12 :     for ( ss=poly ; ss!=NULL; ss=ss->next ) {
    4042           3 :         if ( ss->first->prev==NULL ) {
    4043           0 :             PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError, "The polygonal pen must be a closed, convex polygon. This one is not closed." );
    4044           0 : return( false );
    4045             :         } else {
    4046          12 :             for ( sp=ss->first, cnt=0; cnt<255; ++cnt ) {
    4047          12 :                 pts[cnt] = sp->me;
    4048          12 :                 if ( !sp->next->knownlinear ) {
    4049           0 :                     PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError, "The polygonal pen must be a closed, convex polygon. This one is has curved edges." );
    4050           0 : return( false );
    4051             :                 }
    4052          12 :                 sp = sp->next->to;
    4053          12 :                 if ( sp==ss->first ) {
    4054           3 :                     ++cnt;
    4055           3 :             break;
    4056             :                 }
    4057             :             }
    4058           3 :             if ( cnt==255 ) {
    4059           0 :                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError, "There are too many vertices on this polygon.");
    4060           0 : return( false );
    4061             :             } else {
    4062             :                 enum PolyType pt;
    4063             :                 int badindex;
    4064           3 :                 pt = PolygonIsConvex(pts,cnt,&badindex);
    4065           3 :                 if ( pt==Poly_Line ) {
    4066           0 :                     PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError, "The polygonal pen must be a closed, convex polygon. This one is a line." );
    4067           0 : return( false );
    4068           3 :                 } else if ( pt==Poly_TooFewPoints ) {
    4069           0 :                     PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError, "The polygonal pen must be a closed, convex polygon. This one has too few points." );
    4070           0 : return( false );
    4071           3 :                 } else if ( pt!=Poly_Convex ) {
    4072           0 :                     if ( pt==Poly_PointOnEdge )
    4073           0 :                         PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError, "There are at least 3 colinear vertices.");
    4074             :                     else
    4075           0 :                         PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError, "The polygonal pen must be a closed, convex polygon. This one is concave." );
    4076           0 : return( false );
    4077             :                 }
    4078             :             }
    4079             :         }
    4080             :     }
    4081           3 : return( true );
    4082             : }

    4507             :              "Transform a layer by a 6 element matrix." },

    4509             :             "Transform a glyph by two non-linear expressions (one for x, one for y)." },

    5883           0 : return( -1 );
    5884             :     }
    5885           0 :     cnt = PySequence_Size(value);

    8065           0 : static PyObject *TupleOfGlyphNames(char *str,int extras) {
    8066             :     int cnt;
    8067             :     char *pt, *start;
    8068             :     PyObject *tuple;
    8069             :     int ch;
    8070             : 
    8071           0 :     for ( pt=str; *pt==' '; ++pt );
    8072           0 :     if ( *pt=='\0' )
    8073           0 : return( PyTuple_New(extras));
    8074             : 
    8075           0 :     for ( cnt=1; *pt; ++pt ) {
    8076           0 :         if ( *pt==' ' ) {
    8077           0 :             ++cnt;
    8078           0 :             while ( pt[1]==' ' ) ++pt;
    8079             :         }
    8080             :     }
    8081           0 :     tuple = PyTuple_New(extras+cnt);
    8082           0 :     for ( pt=str, cnt=0; *pt; ) {
    8083           0 :         while ( *pt==' ' ) ++pt;
    8084           0 :         if ( *pt=='\0' )
    8085           0 :     break;
    8086           0 :         start = pt;
    8087           0 :         while ( *pt!=' ' && *pt!='\0' ) ++pt;
    8088           0 :         ch = *pt; *pt = '\0';
    8089           0 :         PyTuple_SetItem(tuple,extras+cnt,STRING_TO_PY(start));
    8090           0 :         *pt = ch;
    8091           0 :         ++cnt;
    8092             :     }

   12086           0 : static PyObject *PyFF_Font_get_baseline(PyFF_Font *self, void *UNUSED(closure), struct Base *base) {

   12091             : 
   12092           0 :     if ( CheckIfFontClosed(self) )
   12093           0 : return (NULL);
   12094           0 :     if ( base==NULL )
   12095           0 : Py_RETURN_NONE;
   12096             :

   12102             : 
   12103           0 :     for ( bs=base->scripts, cnt=0; bs!=NULL; bs=bs->next, ++cnt );
   12104           0 :     scripts = PyTuple_New(cnt);
   12105           0 :     PyTuple_SetItem(ret,1,scripts);
   12106           0 :     for ( bs=base->scripts, i=0; bs!=NULL; bs=bs->next, ++i ) {

   12110           0 :         if ( base->baseline_cnt==0 ) {

   13031           0 :     else if ( strmatch(str,"TwilightPntCnt")==0 )
   13032           0 :         val = memushort(data,32,8*sizeof(uint16));
   13033           0 :     else if ( strmatch(str,"StorageCnt")==0 )
   13034           0 :         val = memushort(data,32,9*sizeof(uint16));
   13035           0 :     else if ( strmatch(str,"MaxStackDepth")==0 )
   13036           0 :         val = memushort(data,32,12*sizeof(uint16));
   13037           0 :     else if ( strmatch(str,"FDEFs")==0 )
   13038           0 :         val = memushort(data,32,10*sizeof(uint16));
   13039           0 :     else if ( strmatch(str,"IDEFs")==0 )
   13040           0 :         val = memushort(data,32,11*sizeof(uint16));
   13041             :     else
   13042           0 :         val = -1;
   13043           0 : return( Py_BuildValue("i",val));

   13543           1 : static void TableAddInstrs(SplineFont *sf, uint32 tag,int replace,
   13544             :                            uint8 *instrs,int icnt) {
   13545             :     struct ttf_table *tab;

   13550             :

   13640           0 : static PyObject *PyFFFont_importBitmaps(PyFF_Font *self,PyObject *args) {
   13641             :     char *filename;

   13647           0 :     if ( CheckIfFontClosed(self) )
   13648           0 : return (NULL);

   13651             :             &to_background) )

   13672           0 :         format = fv_pk;
   13673           0 :         back = true;
   13674             :     } else {
   13675           0 :         PyErr_Format(PyExc_EnvironmentError, "Bad extension for bitmap font");

   13682           0 :     else if ( format==fv_pcf )

   13684           0 :     else if ( format==fv_ttf )

   13686           0 :     else if ( format==fv_pk )
   13687           0 :         ok = FVImportBDF(fv,locfilename,true, back);
   13688           0 :     free(locfilename);

   13690           0 :         PyErr_Format(PyExc_EnvironmentError, "Could not load bitmap font");
   13691           0 : return( NULL );
   13692             :     }
   13693             :

   13697             : /* Font comparison flags */
   13698             : static struct flaglist compflags[] = {
   13699             :     { "outlines",               1 },
   13700             :     { "outlines-exactly",       2 },
   13701             :     { "warn-outlines-mismatch",         4 },
   13702             :     { "hints",                          8 },
   13703             :     { "warn-refs-unlink",       0x40 },
   13704             :     { "strikes",                0x80 },
   13705             :     { "fontnames",              0x100 },

   13708             :     { "add-outlines",           0x800 },
   13709             :     { "create-glyphs",                  0x1000 },

   13713           0 : static PyObject *PyFFFont_compareFonts(PyFF_Font *self,PyObject *args) {
   13714             :     /* Compare the current font against the named one        */
   13715             :     /* output to a file (used /dev/null if no output wanted) */
   13716             :     /* flags control what tests are done                     */
   13717             :     PyFF_Font *other;
   13718             :     PyObject *flagstuple, *ret;
   13719             :     FILE *diffs;
   13720             :     int flags;
   13721             :     char *filename, *locfilename;
   13722             : 
   13723           0 :     if ( CheckIfFontClosed(self) )
   13724           0 : return (NULL);
   13725           0 :     if ( !PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"OesO", &other, "UTF-8", &filename, &flagstuple ))
   13726           0 : return( NULL );
   13727           0 :     locfilename = utf82def_copy(filename);
   13728           0 :     PyMem_Free(filename);
   13729             : 
   13730           0 :     if ( !PyType_IsSubtype(&PyFF_FontType, Py_TYPE(other)) ) {
   13731           0 :         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,"First argument must be a fontforge font");
   13732           0 :         free(locfilename);
   13733           0 : return( NULL );
   13734             :     }
   13735           0 :     if ( CheckIfFontClosed(other) )
   13736           0 : return (NULL);
   13737           0 :     flags = FlagsFromTuple(flagstuple,compflags,"comparison flag");
   13738           0 :     if ( flags==FLAG_UNKNOWN ) {
   13739           0 :         free(locfilename);
   13740           0 : return( NULL );
   13741             :     }
   13742             : 
   13743           0 :     if ( strcmp(locfilename,"-")==0 )
   13744           0 :         diffs = stdout;
   13745             :     else {
   13746           0 :         diffs = fopen(locfilename,"w");
   13747           0 :         if ( diffs==NULL ) {
   13748           0 :             PyErr_SetFromErrnoWithFilename(PyExc_IOError,locfilename);
   13749           0 :             free(locfilename);

   16531             : static ItalicInfo default_ii = {
   16532             :     -13,                    /* Italic angle (in degrees) */
   16533             :     .95,                    /* xheight percent */
   16534             : 
   16535             :     /* horizontal squash, lsb, stemsize, countersize, rsb */
   16536             :     { .91, .89, .90, .91 }, /* For lower case */
   16537             :     { .91, .93, .93, .91 }, /* For upper case */
   16538             :     { .91, .93, .93, .91 }, /* For things which are neither upper nor lower case */
   16539             :     srf_flat,               /* Secondary serifs (initial, medial on "m", descender on "p", "q" */
   16540             :     true,                   /* Transform bottom serifs */
   16541             :     true,                   /* Transform serifs at x-height */
   16542             :     false,                  /* Transform serifs on ascenders */
   16543             :     true,                   /* Transform serifs on diagonal stems at baseline and x-height */
   16544             : 
   16545             :     true,                   /* Change the shape of an "a" to look like a "d" without ascender */
   16546             :     false,                  /* Change the shape of "f" so it descends below baseline (straight down no flag at end) */
   16547             :     true,                   /* Change the shape of "f" so the bottom looks like the top */
   16548             :     true,                   /* Remove serifs from the bottom of descenders */
   16549             : 
   16550             :     true,                   /* Make the cyrillic "phi" glyph have a top like an "f" */
   16551             :     true,                   /* Make the cyrillic "i" glyph look like a latin "u" */
   16552             :     true,                   /* Make the cyrillic "pi" glyph look like a latin "n" */
   16553             :     true,                   /* Make the cyrillic "te" glyph look like a latin "m" */
   16554             :     true,                   /* Make the cyrillic "sha" glyph look like a latin "m" rotated 180 */
   16555             :     true,                   /* Make the cyrillic "dje" glyph look like a latin smallcaps T (not implemented) */
   16556             :     true,                   /* Make the cyrillic "dzhe" glyph look like a latin "u" (same glyph used for cyrillic "i") */
   16557             : 
   16558             :     ITALICINFO_REMAINDER
   16559             : };

   17481             : /*                   Python Interface to FontForge Auto-Kerning               */

   17483             : #include "autowidth2.h"
   17484             : 
   17485             : /* To give the user the ability to create his own routine to calculate the */
   17486             : /*  visual separation between two glyphs, we must provide a python type which */
   17487             : /*  contains the same data as the C type: AW_Glyph */
   17488             : /* Sigh. And another which is almost exactly the same for the left/right arrays*/
   17489             :

   17491             :     PyObject_HEAD

   17494             : } PyFF_AWGlyph;

   17857             : 
   17858             : /* User supplied python function which calculates the optical separation between */
   17859             : /*  two glyphs when placed so that there bounding boxes are contiguous. I assume */
   17860             : /*  that optical separation is linear (so if I move the bounding boxes by 3 em */
   17861             : /*  then the optical separation also increases by 3 em) */
   17862             : void *PyFF_GlyphSeparationHook = NULL;          /* Actually a python object */
   17863             : static PyObject *PyFF_GlyphSeparationArg = NULL;
   17864             : 
   17865           0 : int PyFF_GlyphSeparation(AW_Glyph *g1,AW_Glyph *g2,AW_Data *all) {
   17866             :     PyObject *arglist, *result;
   17867             :     int ret;
   17868             : 
   17869           0 :     if ( PyFF_GlyphSeparationHook==NULL )
   17870           0 : return( -1 );
   17871             : 
   17872           0 :     arglist = PyTuple_New(PyFF_GlyphSeparationArg!=NULL &&
   17873           0 :                             PyFF_GlyphSeparationArg!=Py_None?4:3);
   17874           0 :     Py_XINCREF((PyObject *) PyFF_GlyphSeparationHook);
   17875           0 :     PyTuple_SetItem(arglist,0,GetPythonObjectForAWGlyph(g1));
   17876           0 :     PyTuple_SetItem(arglist,1,GetPythonObjectForAWGlyph(g2));
   17877           0 :     PyTuple_SetItem(arglist,2,GetPythonObjectForAWData(all));
   17878           0 :     if ( PyFF_GlyphSeparationArg!=NULL &&
   17879           0 :                             PyFF_GlyphSeparationArg!=Py_None ) {
   17880           0 :         PyTuple_SetItem(arglist,3,PyFF_GlyphSeparationArg);
   17881           0 :         Py_XINCREF(PyFF_GlyphSeparationArg);
   17882             :     }
   17883           0 :     result = PyEval_CallObject(PyFF_GlyphSeparationHook, arglist);
   17884           0 :     Py_DECREF(arglist);
   17885           0 :     if ( PyErr_Occurred()!=NULL ) {
   17886           0 :         PyErr_Print();
   17887           0 :         Py_XDECREF(result);
   17888           0 : return( -1 );
   17889             :     } else {
   17890           0 :         ret = PyInt_AsLong(result);
   17891           0 :         Py_XDECREF(result);
   17892           0 :         if ( PyErr_Occurred()!=NULL ) {
   17893           0 :             PyErr_Print();
   17894           0 : return( -1 );
   17895             :         }
   17896           0 : return( ret );
   17897             :     }

   18234           0 :     Py_DECREF(arglist);

   18237           0 :     Py_XDECREF(result);
   18238           0 :     if ( PyErr_Occurred()!=NULL ) {
   18239           0 :         PyErr_Print();

   18241           0 : return( NULL );
   18242             :     } else
   18243           0 : return( ret );
   18244             : }

   18392             : /* These individual "create module" functions are only needed because
   18393             :  * Python itself needs a specific "callback" function pointer for each
   18394             :  * module that takes no arguments.  Used by RegisterAllPyModules().
   18395             :  */
   18396             : #if PY_MAJOR_VERSION >= 3
   18397             : /* Python 3 module init functions return a pointer to the module object, or NULL */
   18398             : #define ff_crmod(name) \
   18399             : PyMODINIT_FUNC CreatePyModule_##name(void) {\
   18400             :     return CreatePyModule(&module_def_##name);\
   18401             : }
   18402             : #else
   18403             : /* Python 2 module init functions do not return any value */
   18404             : #define ff_crmod(name) \
   18405             : static void CreatePyModule_##name(void) {\
   18406             :     CreatePyModule(&module_def_##name);\
   18407             : }
   18408             : #endif
   18409             : #define ff_fixmod(name) \

   18568          12 : static void RegisterAllPyModules(void) {
   18569             :     /* This adds all the modules to Python's 'builtin' module list.
   18570             :      * It allows an 'import some_module' to always work, as python
   18571             :      * knows where to find the module in already-loaded code without
   18572             :      * having to search the filesystem for module files/libraries.
   18573             :      */
   18574          12 :     fixup_module_definitions();
   18575          48 :     for ( unsigned i=0; i<NUM_MODULES; i++ ) {
   18576          36 :         PyImport_AppendInittab( all_modules[i]->module_name,
   18577          36 :                                 all_modules[i]->runtime.modinit_func );
   18578             :     }
   18579          12 : }

   18603             : /* This is called to start up the embedded python interpreter */

   18607          12 :         return;

   18612          12 :     python_initialized = 1;
   18613             : 
   18614             :     /* The embedded python interpreter is now functionally
   18615             :      * "running". We can modify it to our needs.
   18616             :      */

   18620             : 
   18621             : /* PyFF_Main() -- This is called to run a script as the main task, by
   18622             :  * running the command:   fontforge -script somescript.py arg1 arg2 ...
   18623             :  *
   18624             :  * This function is passed the entire original command line.
   18625             :  * Before passing it to Python, it must eliminate all the
   18626             :  * options up to and including the '-script' option, but while
   18627             :  * preserving argv[0].
   18628             :  *
   18629             :  * Also note that Python 3 expects argv to be C wide strings.
   18630             :  */
   18631             : #define ARGV_CHAR_TYPE PY3OR2(wchar_t, char)
   18632             : static ARGV_CHAR_TYPE ** copy_argv(char *arg0, int argc ,char **argv);
   18633             : 
   18634          12 : _Noreturn void PyFF_Main(int argc,char **argv,int start) {
   18635             :     char *arg;
   18636             :     ARGV_CHAR_TYPE **newargv;
   18637             :     int newargc;
   18638             :     int exitcode;
   18639             : 
   18640          12 :     no_windowing_ui = running_script = true;
   18641             : 
   18642          12 :     FontForge_InitializeEmbeddedPython();
   18643          12 :     PyFF_ProcessInitFiles();
   18644             : 
   18645             :     /* Skip '-script' option */
   18646          12 :     arg = argv[start];
   18647          12 :     if ( *arg=='-' && arg[1]=='-' ) ++arg;
   18648          12 :     if ( strcmp(arg,"-script")==0 )
   18649          12 :         ++start;
   18650             : 
   18651             :     /* Make new argv array */
   18652          12 :     newargc = argc - start + 1;
   18653          12 :     newargv = copy_argv(argv[0], newargc-1, &argv[start] );

   18655             :     /* Run Python */
   18656          12 :     exitcode = Py_Main( newargc, newargv );

   18853           0 : static void LoadFilesInPythonInitDir(char *dir) {
   18854             :     DIR *diro;
   18855             :     struct dirent *ent;
   18856           0 :     struct string_list *filelist=NULL;
   18857             :     struct string_list *item;
   18858             : 
   18859           0 :     diro = opendir(dir);
   18860           0 :     if ( diro==NULL )           /* It's ok not to have any python init scripts */
   18861           0 : return;
   18862             : 
   18863           0 :     while ( (ent = readdir(diro))!=NULL ) {
   18864             :         char buffer[PATH_MAX+2];
   18865           0 :         char *pt = strrchr(ent->d_name,'.');
   18866           0 :         if ( pt==NULL )
   18867           0 :     continue;
   18868           0 :         if ( strcmp(pt,".py")==0 ) {
   18869           0 :             snprintf( buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%s/%s", dir, ent->d_name );
   18870           0 :             filelist = prepend_string_list( filelist, buffer );
   18871             :         }
   18872             :     }
   18873           0 :     closedir(diro);
   18874             : 
   18875           0 :     filelist = sort_string_list( filelist );
   18876             : 
   18877           0 :     showPythonErrors = 0;
   18878           0 :     for ( item=filelist; item!=NULL; item=item->next ) {
   18879             :         FILE *fp;
   18880           0 :         char *pathname = item->str;
   18881           0 :         fp = fopen( pathname, "rb" );
   18882           0 :         if ( fp==NULL ) {
   18883           0 :             fprintf(stderr,"Failed to open script \"%s\": %s\n",pathname,strerror(errno));
   18884           0 :             continue;

   19331           0 : const char *NOUI_TTFNameIds(int id) {
